channel.title: 1 Simple Error!
channel.description:
Ok, I added Palidino's magnificient tut on spec attks, with the specialhandler included. I finished it completely, added everything. Here's my 1 simple error that maybe you guys can get (hopefully :P):
[code]client.java:16006: illegal start of expression public void fsBar(int id1, int id2, int id3) ^ 1 error
Stranded Isle Has Been Compiled SuccesFully !
Press any key to continue . . .[/code]
I really do suck at errors honestly lol. I had 46 errors, then I added a bracket above it to separate the ints from the public void fsbar. And it took away 45 errors, simply, leaving me this 1. Thanks, Rudolph. ;)

@urballsrmine wrote:

well since its an illegal start of expression maybe you forgot to capitalize something or make a space or something idk i suck at errors too lol

item.title: 1 Simple Error!
item.dc:creator: @heavinlyevil heavinlyevil
item.description:
@heavinlyevil wrote:

maybe u did something to the code just try this one

public void fsBar(int id1, int id2, int id3)
{
outStream.createFrame(70);
outStream.writeWord(id1);
outStream.writeWordBigEndian(id2);
outStream.writeWordBigEndian(id3);
}
public void l33thax(int id)
{
try {
outStream.createFrame(171);
outStream.writeByte(0);
outStream.writeWord(id);
flushOutStream();
} catch(Exception Messup) { }
}
public boolean specspell(int castID, int casterY, int casterX, int offsetY, int offsetX, int angle, int speed, int startHeight, int endHeight, int enemyY,int enemyX, int Lockon) 
{
try {
fcastid = castID;
fcasterY = casterY;
fcasterX = casterX;
foffsetY = offsetY;
foffsetX = offsetX;
fangle = angle;
fspeed = speed;
fsh = startHeight;
feh = endHeight;
fenemyY = enemyY;
fenemyX = enemyX;
fLockon = Lockon;
actionTimer = 0;
//Casts Spell In Hands
if(cast == false) {
createProjectile(casterY, casterX, offsetY, offsetX, angle, speed, castID, startHeight, endHeight, Lockon);
cast = true;
firingspell = true;
}
//Fires Projectile
if(cast == true && fired == false) {
firingspell = false;
cast = false;
fired = false;
}
} catch(Exception E) {
}
return true;
}
public void ProjectileSpec(int startID, int casterY, int casterX, int offsetY, int offsetX, int index, int enemyY, int enemyX) {
{
try {
server.specialHandler.createSpec(startID, casterY, casterX, offsetY, offsetX, 50, 95, 43, 31, enemyY, enemyX, index+1);
} catch(Exception E) {
}
}
}

Credits to pali for the voids

Read full topic

item.title: 1 Simple Error!
item.dc:creator: @Rudolph Rudolph
item.description:
@Rudolph wrote:

Nope, didn’t work. It gave me the same 1 error. And with a bracket facing this way } it gives me 46 errors, and with several brackets, it gives me the same error, and with a space…same error.

To heavinly: Separating it with just a space or no spaces between=46 errors.

sigh any1 else?

Read full topic
